metadata.title: Supplementary Materials for A highly conserved cryptic epitope in the receptor-binding domains of SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV

abstract.text: The receptor-binding domain (RBD) (residues 319-541) of the SARS-CoV-2 spike (S) 30 protein (GenBank: QHD43416.1), as well as the RBD (residues 306-527) of the SARS-

CoV S protein (GenBank: ABF65836.1), were cloned into a customized pFastBac vector 32 (37). The RBD constructs were fused with an N-terminal gp67 signal peptide and a C-33 terminal His 6 tag. Recombinant bacmid DNA was generated using the Bac-to-Bac 34 system (Life Technologies). Baculovirus was generated by transfecting purified bacmid 35 DNA into Sf9 cells using FuGENE HD (Promega), and subsequently used to infect 36 suspension cultures of High Five cells (Life Technologies) at an MOI of 5 to 10. Infected 37 High Five cells were incubated at 28 °C with shaking at 110 r.p.m. for 72 h for protein 38 expression. The supernatant was then concentrated using a 10 kDa MW cutoff 39 Centramate cassette (Pall Corporation). The S and RBD proteins were purified by Ni-
40 NTA, followed by size exclusion chromatography, and buffer exchanged into 20 mM Tris-41 HCl pH 7.4 and 150 mM NaCl.

42 43 Expression and purification of CR3022 Fab and IgG 44 The CR3022 Fab heavy (GenBank: DQ168569.1) and light (GenBank: DQ168570.1) 45 chains were cloned into phCMV3. The plasmids were transiently co-transfected into 46 Expi293F cells at a ratio of 2:1 (HC:LC) using ExpiFectamine™ 293 Reagent (Thermo collected at 7 days post-transfection. The Fab was purified with a CaptureSelect™ CH1-49 XL Pre-packed Column (Thermo Fisher Scientific) followed by size exclusion 50 chromatography. 51 52 For full-length IgGs of CR3022, m396 (sequences from PDB 2DD8 (16)), and S230.15 53 (sequences from PDB 6NB6 (38)), the heavy-chain and light-chain plasmids were 54 transiently co-transfected into ExpiCHO cells at a ratio of 2:1 using ExpiFectamine™ 55 CHO Reagent (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer's instructions. 56 The supernatant was collected at 14 days post-transfection. The IgGs were purified 57 using a Protein G column (GE Healthcare), and further purified by size exclusion 58 chromatography. 59 60 Crystallization and structural determination 61 Purified CR3022 Fab and SARS-CoV-2 RBD were mixed at a molar ratio of 1:1 and 62 incubated overnight at 4 °C. The complex (15 mg/ml) was screened for crystallization 63 using the 384 conditions of the JCSG Core Suite (Qiagen) at 293 K on our custom-64 designed robotic CrystalMation system (Rigaku) at Scripps Research by the vapor 65 diffusion method in sitting drops containing 0.1 µl of protein and 0.1 µl of reservoir 66 solution. Optimized crystals were then grown in 80 mM sodium acetate pH 4.6, 1.5 M 67 ammonium sulfate, and 20% glycerol. Crystals were grown for 14 days and then flash 68 cooled in liquid nitrogen. Diffraction data were collected at cryogenic temperature (100 69 K) at beamline 23-ID-D of the Argonne Photon Source (APS) with a beam wavelength of 70 1.033 Å, and processed with HKL2000 (39). Structures were solved by molecular 71 replacement using PHASER with homology models for Fab CR3022 generated from 72 PDB ID: 4KMT (40) and for SARS-CoV-2 RBD generated from a structure of SARS-73 4 CoV-RBD (PDB ID: 2AJF) (41) with SWISS-MODEL (42). Iterative model building and 74 refinement were carried out in COOT (43) and PHENIX (44), respectively. Epitope and 75 paratope residues, as well as their interactions, were identified by accessing PISA at the 76 European Bioinformatics Institute (http://www.ebi.ac.uk/pdbe/prot_int/pistart.html) (34). 77 78 Biolayer interferometry binding assay 79 Binding assays were performed by biolayer interferometry (BLI) using an Octet Red 80 instrument (FortéBio) as described previously (45). Briefly, His 6 -tagged S and RBD 81 proteins at 20 to 100 µg/mL in 1x kinetics buffer (1x PBS, pH 7.4, 0.01% BSA and 82 0.002% Tween 20) were loaded onto Anti-Penta-HIS (HIS1K) biosensors and incubated 83 with the indicated concentrations of CR3022 Fab or IgG. The assay consisted of five 84 steps: 1) baseline: 60 s with 1x kinetics buffer; 2) loading: 300 s with his 6 -tagged S or 85 RBD proteins; 3) baseline: 60 s with 1x kinetics buffer; 4) association: 120 s with 86 samples (Fab or IgG); and 5) dissociation: 120 s with 1x kinetics buffer. For estimating 87 the exact K d , a 1:1 binding model was used. 88 89 Microneutralization assay 109 20, HRP-conjugated goat anti-human IgG (1:5000, GE Healthcare) was added for 1 hour 110 at 37°C. The ELISA plates were then washed five times with PBS containing 0.1% 111 Tween 20. Subsequently, 100 µl of HRP substrate (TMB One) (New Cell & Molecular 112 Biotech) was added into each well. After 20 minutes incubation, the reaction was 113 stopped by adding 50 µl of 2 M H 2 SO 4 solution and analyzed on a Sunrise absorbance 114 microplate reader (Tecan) at 450 nm wavelength. The normalized results were obtained 115 by the calculating the difference between the OD of the purified recombinant protein-116 coated well and the PBS-coated well.

body_text.text: The plates coated with either virus or protein were then blocked with PBS containing 5% 106 non-fat milk powder at room temperature for 2 hours. 100 µl of CR3022 or m396 at a 107 concentration of 200 µg/ml was added to the ELISA wells with different coating condition 108 for 2-hour incubation at 37°C. After extensive washing with PBS containing 0.1% Tween
PDB 6CRX is used a model for the double-"up" configuration of SARS-CoV S protein

FIGREF0.text: Scientific) according to the manufacturer's instructions. The supernatant was a dose of 100 tissue culture infective doses 50% (TCID 50 ) determined by Vero and Vero 92 E6 cells respectively. After 1 hour of incubation at 37°C, 35 µl of the virus-antibody 93 mixture was added in quadruplicate to Vero or Vero E6 cell monolayers in 96-well 94 microtiter plates. After 1 hour of adsorption, the virus-antibody mixture was removed and 95 replaced with 150 µl of virus growth medium in each well. The plates were incubated for 96 3 days at 37°C in 5% CO 2 in a humidified incubator. A cytopathic effect was observed at 97 day 3 post-inoculation. The highest plasma dilution that protected 50% of the replicate 5 wells was denoted as the neutralizing antibody titer. A virus back-titration of the input 99 virus was included in each batch of tests. 100 101 ELISA binding assay to virus and RBD 102 96-well enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) plates (Nunc MaxiSorp, Thermo 103 Fisher Scientific) were first coated overnight with 10 5 TCID 50 SARS-CoV-2 or SARS-CoV 104 or 100 ng of purified recombinant RBD protein of the two viruses per well in PBS buffer.

FIGREF1.text: Comparison of CR3022 sequence to its putative germline sequence.

FIGREF2.text: Alignment of CR3022 (A) with the germline IGHV5-51 sequence, and (B) with the 120 germline IGKV4-1 sequence. The regions that correspond to CDR H1, H2, H3, L1, L2, 121 and L3 are indicated. Residues that differ from the germline are highlighted in red.

FIGREF3.text: Residue positions in the CDRs are labeled according to the Kabat numbering scheme.

FIGREF4.text: C) Sequence of the V-D-J junction of CR3022, with putative gene segments (blue) and

FIGREF6.text: Electron density maps for epitope and paratope regions and structural chains in the epitope region (cyan) of SARS-CoV-2 contoured at 1 σ. (B) Final 2Fo-Fc 130 electron density maps for the paratope region of CR3022 contoured at 1 σ. The heavy 131 chain is colored in orange, and light chain in yellow. Residues are labeled. (C) Somatic 132 mutations V H S28G, V H T38I, V H S39T, V H D56E, and V L N28I are located in the CR3022 133 paratope region. Hydrogen bonds are represented by dashed lines. CR3022 heavy 134 chain is in orange and light chain is in yellow. SARS-CoV-2 RBD is in light grey. 9 136 Fig. S3. Sensorgrams for binding of CR3022 IgG and Fab to RBDs of SARS-CoV-2 137 and SARS-CoV. Binding kinetics of CR3022 Fab and IgG against the RBDs of SARSrepresents the response. Blue lines represent the response curves and red lines 140 represent the 1:1 binding model. Binding kinetics were measured for three to four 141 concentrations of IgG or Fab at 2-fold dilution ranging from 500 nM to 62.5 nM. The K d 142 and R 2 of the fitting are indicated. The enhanced binding of IgG as compared to Fab is 143 likely due to bivalent binding. Of note, stoichiometry cannot be inferred from this 144 experiment. Previously, Tian et al. (6) reported a K d of 6 nM between CR3022 and SARS-CoV-2 RBD. However, there are several differences between the two 146 experiments. Firstly, CR3022 was expressed as single-chain fragment variable (scFv) in 147 Tian et al. (6), but as an Fab in our study. Secondly, CR3022 was expressed in E. coli in 148 Tian et al. (6), but in mammalian cells in our study. Thirdly, SARS-CoV-2 RBD was

FIGREF7.text: Neutralization activity of SARS-neutralizing monoclonal antibodies 153 against SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV. Microneutralization of SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-154 CoV with monoclonal antibodies (A) CR3022 (4), (B) S230.15(38), and (C) m396(16).

FIGREF8.text: Neutralization of 100 TCID 50 of each virus was performed in quadruplicate. S230.15 and 156 m396 are SARS-CoV-specific antibodies that do not cross-react with SARS-CoV-2 (6, 159 160 Fig. S5. Comparison of the "up" conformations between the SARS-CoV-2 and 161 SARS-CoV S proteins. (A) Structural alignment of the one-"up" S proteins from SARS-

FIGREF9.text: PDB 6VSB(17)) and SARS-CoV (PDB 6CRW(21)). The RBD with an "up"13 conformation from SARS-CoV-2 is in blue and from SARS-CoV is in green. (B) The RBD 164 open angle is represented by a dihedral angle between the RBD and the horizontal 165 plane. Given that the RBD of interest is on protomer 1, the dihedral angle is measured 166 by the angle of P507 Cα (protomer 1) -R983 Cα (protomer 2) -R983 Cα (protomer 1) -167 R983 Cα (protomer 3) for SARS-CoV-2, which corresponds to of P493 Cα (protomer 1) 168 -R965 Cα (protomer 2) -R965 Cα (protomer 1) -R965 Cα (protomer 3) for SARS-169 CoV. For this analysis, S protein structures with PDB IDs of 6VSB (17), 6VYB (18) were 170 used for SARS-CoV-2, whereas 5X5B (19), 6CRX (21), 6CS0, 6CS1, 6CRW (21), 6ACD 171 (46), and 6CRZ (21) were used for SARS-CoV. (C) Root-mean-square deviation (RMSD Cα) of the RBDs from different structures were computed using "super" function in in this analysis. 14 Fig. S6. Modeling of the binding of CR3022 to the homotrimeric SARS-CoV S 178 protein. Same as panels D and E in Fig. 4, except that the S protein from SARS-CoV 179 was used for modeling compared to SARS-CoV-2 in Fig. 4. (A) Binding of CR3022 to 180 single-"up" configuration would clash (indicated by the red circles) with the S protein.

FIGREF10.text: CR3022 variable region clashes with the S2 subunit. Clash 2: CR3022 constant 182 region clashes with NTD. Clash 3: CR3022 variable region clashes with the neighboring 183 RBD that is in "down" conformation. CR3022 variable region is colored yellow. CR3022 184 constant region is colored brown. RBD in "up" conformation is colored cyan. RBD in 185 "down" conformation is colored pink. PDB 6CRW is used as a model for the single-"up" 186 configuration of SARS-CoV S protein (21). (B) Clash 3 can be resolved when the 187 neighboring RBD is in "up" conformation (i.e. S protein in double-"up" configuration).

TABREF0.text: X-ray data collection and refinement statistics Numbers in parentheses refer to the highest resolution shell. b Rsym = Σhkl Σi | Ihkl,i -<Ihkl> | / Σhkl Σi Ihkl,i and Rpim = Σhkl (1/(n-1)) 1/2 Σi | Ihkl,i -<Ihkl> | / Σhkl Σi Ihkl,i, where Ihkl,i is the scaled intensity of the i th measurement of reflection h, k, l, <Ihkl> is the average intensity for that reflection, and n is the redundancy. c CC1/2 = Pearson correlation coefficient between two random half datasets.d Rcryst = Σhkl | Fo -Fc | / Σhkl | Fo | x 100,where Fo and Fc are the observed and calculated structure factors, respectively. e Rfree was calculated as for Rcryst, but on a test set comprising 5% of the data excluded from refinement.

TABREF1.text: Hydrogen bonds and salt bridges identified at the SARS-CoV-2 RBD andCR3022 interface using the PISA program

TABREF2.text: Epitope residues on the SARS-CoV-2 RBD and 197 their buried surface area upon binding to CR3022
